org.mitre.provenance.simulate

Class DAGAholic

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mitre.provenance.plusobject.ProvenanceCollection
      • org.mitre.provenance.simulate.SyntheticGraph
        • org.mitre.provenance.simulate.DAGAholic
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public class DAGAholic
extends SyntheticGraph
    Generate a random DAG. This is the "DAGAholic" method of creating random graphs. Note this object is a ProvenanceCollection, and so can be easily stored/serialized/reported as such.

    One annoying implementation detail: we actually have to keep a second copy of nodes and edges; the superclass tends to store nodes/edges in a map, but we need to be able to refer to them in an ordered list. The super-class doesn't support that, so we need to implement that for this class.

    Author:
    DMALLEN

      • DAGAholic

        public DAGAholic(SyntheticGraphProperties props)
          throws PLUSException
        Create a new DAGAholic generator
        Parameters:
        wfName - the name of the workflow to generate
        nodes - the number of nodes the final graph should contain
        pctChance - the percentage changes (between 0.0 and 1.0) that any two nodes will be connected.
        pctData - this percentage of nodes will be data; the remainder will be invocations.
        sgf - the SGF to associate with all of the objects in the graph.
        protect - the number of objects to protect in the graph (randomly chosen)
        Throws:
        Exception
        PLUSException
